head.supplied: Melbourne botanic Garden ¶ 3 July 1862. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor of submitting to you a voucher for the compensation, to which the claimant, Mr John Dallachy according to the new civil service bill...

div.p: W62/4355, unit 749, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor of submitting to you a voucher for the compensation, to which the claimant, Mr John Dallachy according to the new civil service bill would be entitled in consequence of the abolishment of his office as Curator of the Melbourne botanic Garden.

Mr Dallachy being desirous to open a private nursery and depending for this purpose on the means of his compensation, I beg to solicit, that his claims may receive the early and favourable consideration of the Government.

div.p: I have the honor to be,
